comment.text: Works fine with KDE on x86_64, AMD Ryzen 7, in conjunction with the other updates in testing (tesing repos enabled + up to date as of now). No dedicated tests for the CVEs.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-32573 qt: Uninitialized variable usage in m_unitsPerEm

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-32573 qt: Uninitialized variable usage in m_unitsPerEm

long_desc.thetext:
In Qt before 5.15.14, 6.0.x through 6.2.x before 6.2.9, and 6.3.x through 6.5.x before 6.5.1, QtSvg QSvgFont m_unitsPerEm initialization is mishandled.

https://codereview.qt-project.org/c/qt/qtsvg/+/474093

Created qt tracking bugs for this issue:

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as

bugs.title: CVE-2023-34410 qt:  allows remote attacker to bypass security restrictions caused by flaw in certificate validation

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-34410 qt: allows remote attacker to bypass security restrictions caused by flaw in certificate validation

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in Qt before 5.15.15, 6.x before 6.2.9, and 6.3.x through 6.5.x before 6.5.2. Certificate validation for TLS does not always consider whether the root of a chain is a configured CA certificate.

References:
https://codereview.qt-project.org/c/qt/qtbase/+/477560
https://codereview.qt-project.org/c/qt/qtbase/+/480002

Created qt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2212749]

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2212750]

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:6369 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:6369

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2023:6967 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:6967
